channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Confusion stirs amid conflicting statements on 'house-to-house' search for COVID-19 patients
item.author: Franco Luna
item.description: "We don't have a provision for house-to-house. Only the political critics of the government, again, weaponizing this very important task of tracing," said Roque.

item.title: Hontiveros on house-to-house search for coronavirus patients: Like Oplan Tokhang but for COVID
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: Oplan Tokhang is the police practice of going house-to-house most often associated with the government's bloody war on drugs, which has reaped over 5,000 deaths by Philippine National Police figures but as high as 27,000 fatalities by the count of several rights groups.

item.title: ‘Susceptible to overreach’: House-to-house search for COVID-19 patients alarms CHR
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: The CHR official also stressed that the constitutional right of people to be secure in their houses makes the forcible entry, search, arrest and seizure of individuals inside the safety of their abodes without a determined probable cause illegal.

item.title: With new South China Sea policy, US now a defender of Philippines' arbitral award — analyst
item.author: Patricia Lourdes Viray
item.description: With Washington's latest policy declaration in the South China Sea, the Philippines could capitalize on the diplomatic support of its ASEAN neighbors and the US, along with its allies, an analyst said.

item.title: Shift to more relaxed community quarantine 'out of the question' for Metro Manila — Roque
item.description: Following several spikes in the country's novel coronavirus cases, Malacañang on Wednesday said that relaxing community quarantine in Metro Manila is "out of the question."

item.title: Villar, appointed as isolation czar, to isolate self after testing positive for COVID-19
item.description: (Update 1, 11:09 a.m.) DPWH chief Mark Villar announced his test results in a Facebook post Wednesday.

item.title: Tougher US policy on South China Sea came after it deployed strike groups in the area
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: A week before the United States announced a tougher policy on the South China Sea, it was already touting its naval might in the contested waters following China's maneuvers in the area while the world was occupied with pandemic lockdowns.

item.title: China withheld COVID-19 info — SWS poll
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Three out of five Filipinos believe that China withheld information on COVID-19 from the world, the latest survey by the Social Weather Stations showed.

item.title: China blasts Locsin statement
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: China slammed the Philippines’ declaration of the South China Sea ruling by an international tribunal as “non-negotiable” with no possibility of “compromise” or “change,” as Beijing highlighted the consensus reached by the two countries on handling the arbitration case.

item.title: 70% of Pinoys want Philippines to assert West Philippine Sea rights
item.author: Helen Flores
item.description: Seven in 10 Filipinos believe the government should assert its rights over islands in the West Philippine Sea, results of the latest Social Weather Stations survey revealed yesterday.
